intro: Erigeron mendocinensis, commonly known as Mendo's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
